name: unofficially
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not official, or not from a person in authority, the government, etc: They said she had unofficially agreed to the idea. Unofficially, police estimated there to be 200,000 demonstrators. See
unofficial
More examplesFewer examplesThe amount of the payment is unofficially reported to be $7.5 million. He is expected to meet unofficially with members of Congress.Some of the data in the survey were released unofficially in August.
